ratings.comment: Took this class online during the summer. She was a terrible professor who barely posted any of the required homework and files for the class. She also wouldn't respond to emails at all. If you don't have to take this class with her avoid it at all costs.

GET CHEGG. only way to pass the course. clear english but does problems too quick to keep up. Ask her a question and you will be answered in a very rude and sarcastic way. she expects you to know everything. four exams, but posts tons of old exams with solutions which is very useful for studying. chegg has solutions for all hw problems. get chegg.

Laurie Riley, where to begin, she looks like Sadness from Inside Out and it is the exact feeling you'll get when attending lecture. Lectures are the most confusing experiences and she rarely provides usable feedback, often belittling students and rolling her eyes when a question is asked. Honestly, skip lecture and watch Plesha's videos, good luck.

The only positive thing I can think to say about Laurie is that English is her first language. Still, you probably won't be able to understand what she is saying as she is quiet, monotone, and just doesn't make much sense. Be prepared to teach yourself everything because a rock has a better teaching ability.

"Instructor" Riley is no longer teaching courses after this semester but I'd say she's yet to teach a course as her "lectures" are reading directly from the slide and not being able to explain the logic behind things. Lectures often don't take the full time because she doesn't explain where numbers come from in examples. Incredibly rude/arrogant

As a whole, Prof. Riley does not do a great job teaching this course. I've found the homework to be the most beneficial learning tool. If you can succeed at the homework, you will pass the tests. Lectures are good for introducing concepts, but in-depth understanding comes from homework. Trust me.

Riley is awkward and not confident and the students end up paying for it. During lecture you can barely hear her quivering voice as she reads lecture slides word for word at a ridiculous pace. Some lectures literally took 25 minutes because she talked so fast. You are better off skipping lecture completely and watching the video lectures.

Very unspecific about everything in lecture. Everything was based upon example problems with zero foundation. Easy enough to get a B because the curve is so low. Terrible teacher, rude outside of class.

discussion was not very helpful because there were so many students in one time period. tests take up most of the grades and are not always as easy to figure out as the homework. chegg is helpful with the homework. online quizzes are not statics tests but more like tests to see how quick you can complete a quiz. This course could be reconstructed..

For lectures, Professor Riley reads off of another professor's old slides and does a lot of example problems (also from the other professor) but doesn't provide any insight on why certain steps must be performed in order reach the solution. Overall, the quality of this class is extremely lacking, especially for such an important foundation course.

Laurie is one of the worst lecturers I've ever had in my entire life. Reads verbatim what is on the slides. Does not teach the logic behind anything, just gives the formula and hopes you remember it. Tests are difficult and you don't get the grades back until three weeks after you've taken it. Avoid at all costs
Good luck

Goes through lectures too fast and doesn't have any original thoughts, just regurgitates the information presented to her on the slides made by the textbook company. Assumes you know a lot of background information. Makes people feel stupid for asking questions and doesn't even answer the question, just gives them sarcasm and laughs. Monotone voice

Lacked social skills which severely affected her teaching and how accessible she was to students. Laurie knew her stuff but didn't know how to make us know our stuff. Grading scale was awful, and her lack of empathy for students makes the class extremely discouraging. She also scheduled assignments terribly, from homework to quizzes.

Worst instructor I've had yet; I refuse to call her a professor, because I don't think she technically is one, & if she is, she doesn't deserve to be. She thinks she's hot stuff & doesn't respect her students, often almost belittling them when asked a question. She has no confidence whatsoever and it's very evident by her annoying, quivering voice.

I went to her office hours and she was much more  helpful then in lecture. This was her first time teaching the class and she made rookie mistakes, she could be better after teaching a little more. A very tough class regardless of the professor. Put in the work and you'll pass.
Laurie is a great professor and explains a very difficult subject well. She is pretty intimidating, but very kind.

If you've ever had a TA lecture because the professor was gone for a that day, that's what this class was like every day. Except it wasn't the really smart friendly TA, it was the one that never gave you a straight answer and tried making you feel stupid.

Lectures are pointless, she repeats nearly everything word for word from Plesha's and Witt's lectures, which are online. I stopped going to lecture after I asked one question during a midterm review and got the response "It gets complicated", guess what was on the midterm... Read the book, watch online lectures, practice and the prof wont matter.

She just reads off of slides in her lectures and lacks interpersonal skills. Very little effort is put into explaining the reasoning behind various concepts. This has honestly affected my interest in Engineering. Although her lectures are useless, she can help out in her office hours.

I'd rather jump off a bridge into a pile of sharpened chopsticks than take a class taught by her again. Rubbing wasabi in my eyes would be more pleasant. No interpersonal skills whatsoever. Glad to be done with this class.

She is not very good at teaching because she just reads the slides off and doesn't explain equations that we use very well. Although I will say that over the semester she has gotten nicer, she is still not a great teacher. I would avoid if possible. Tests are pretty fair though, but tough.

Laurie is standoffish, and teaching a difficult class with no curve, she would visibly roll her eyes at student questions and was discouraging at the start of the sem. See below to see how much animosity its caused. She has improved though. Still, sign up for PREPS, subscribe to Chegg to get Textbook solutions for the HW. YOU WILL NEED IT. She's ok

It would be more comfortable to burn in the firey pits of hell than take this class. I've heard other statics profs are great but I ended up with the human equivalent to a polar bear; she looks like she wouldn'the hurt you but is really on the hunt for flesh and blood. Take statics a different semester.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! She wasn't accesible outside of class at all and didn't explain anything in class. The statics professor changes every year do I recommend do yourself a favor and waiting it out.

Fellow classmates teach me better than Laurie Riley herself does, and if you want to pass have the solutions manual to help with homework.  Even with this each weeks's homework take upwards of 5 hrs the worst being around 10 hrs and this doesn't include time for studying or crying.
horrible professor

I like Laurie, but I heard this is her first year teaching, she might get better, right now she is not great. She doesn't care. The students acing it have taken Physics 201/207 before. Sign up for Wendt PREPS, and get a Chegg subscription for solution steps for the HW or you WON'T PASS.   DIS is so bad tho, unhelpful w stressful 2min 10Q quizzes.

I sit next to students who take photos of her lecture slides, and she often flips through so quickly they can't even get a picture. Expect to teach yourself everything. Tests are straightforward. Interpersonal skills with students is why 1 star. She snaps frequently, refuses to answer questions, and takes forever to grade tests, will not help you.

If this woman gets hired as a faculty member, the university will be doing students a disservice. She reads directly from the lecture slides and regurgitates the process of solving problems which have already been solved by Plesha in online videos. Consistently answers questions posed by students very poorly and rudely. Tests were fair though.

Its statics, so its gonna be hard. It is clear what she expects, but you have to work hard to get a good grade. Exams are fair. She gets a bad rap by students who don't want to put in the work or are disappointed in the grade they got in the class. Lectures are kinda boring but she clearly explains the material.

She reads directly off of the lecture slides and gives no extra explanations from what the slides say.  She is also very demeaning when a student asks ANY type of clarifying question.  When she when we will get our exams back, she simply replies with "when they're done being graded."  She is ridiculously rude and doesn't seem to care about students

Whenever it comes time to go to her lectures, I genuinely get angry that god gave me the ability of being able to walk to her class.  During her lectures, I can feel my will to live dwindling as she speaks in a perfect monotone voice while reading word for word from her lecture slides..  If you hate yourself and love pain, take her as a lecturer.

Professor Riley is not a good teacher at all. When explaining examples and concepts in lecture, she merely does the work in front of you without explaining the thought process or how to approach a problem, and when you don't understand something and ask her a question or attend office hours, she becomes defensive and blames you for not knowing
